revised_title: On the Clark Cell as a Standard of Electromotive Force: Experiments and Findings
tldr: This article discusses the Clark cell as a standard of electromotive force and its various modes of preparation. It explores the factors affecting the accuracy of the electromotive force, such as temperature, liquid saturation, and the purity of materials. The author compares the Clark cells with Daniells and provides recommendations for their usage in practical applications.
